data.title: not only for wine...they have a great menu too!
data.text: This is the only wine bar in Frederick where you can purchase a card to put in a machine to get "shots" of wine, half glasses or full glasses, depending on your liking. There is a wide selection of many vintages of wine, and my wife loves tasting 4 or 5 wines every time we go there. The menu is great, too, with sumptuous salads, appetizers, and the best falafel wrap in town. Just go there and hang out for a while!

data.title: Quick Date Night
data.text:
My husband and I stopped by this lil wine spot the other night for the 3rd time within a year or two. This was our first time going on a late night. The other two times were during the day and it wasn't as busy. 

The very first time we went over a year or so ago we spoke with the owner. She was really nice. 

The second time we went during the day we ordered a cheese plate which was really good and everything was calm and chill.

This 3rd time a Friday evening not the same as the other two visits the hostess was also the bartender and was serving tables as well needless to say we didn't have the most responsive service however, she was extremely friendly and polite.

I couldn't be to mad because it seems as though they were under staffed and my first two visit wasn't bad at all. However they should really consider being fully staffed especially on busy nights when people tend to hang out the most. 

I've always loved the whole concept of the place. Buy a card (yes you have to pay for the cards) add money to your card then fill your glass up as you please with any wine. You can purchase a taste, half a glass, or a full glass. It's definitely a cool way to taste different wines relax sit back and enjoy the scenery.

data.title: Enjoyable
data.text: We come here often when we just want a glass of wine and a light meal.  I think the card system can be very pricey for the wine tastings so we just tend to order from the house wine list.  The flat breads are quite good, as are the salads.  Mostly, we enjoy the atmosphere and sitting outside watching all the passers by.  Great location.  Good staff and owner, they seem to care and want you to have a good experience.  A nice addition to Frederick down town, glad to see they are still here.

data.title: It was fun
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for a late lunch and some wine on a beautiful Saturday afternoon. Surprisingly, the place was virtually empty. We ordered food and used their "enomatic" wine dispenser. I loved it! You walk around can select 1oz, 2.5 oz, or 5 oz pours of a couple dozen wines. No waiting for table service!  I am fairly knowledgeable about wines and I have to say that I only recognized one of their wines, but they were still good. Food service was a little slow, even though the place was nearly empty. The food (baked Brie and smoked salmon flatbread) was delicious.

data.title: The Candy Shop of Wines
data.text:
My friend asked me to come here for dinner. She had the Wine Card that she loaded with money and then we just swiped it for our choices of wines to drink. (I paid for the food.) As I walked around looking at all of the vats of wine with little spouts sticking out of them,  I thought of the analogy that this is how I felt as a kid in a candy store with all of those tasty tempting choices in front of me. (From Swedish fish as a child to wine as an adult!) 

Seriously, you could go crazy in this place, swiping and tasting wine. But it does add up and the glasses are large and the portions seemed small and overpriced. But I am not a big drinker so it was about right and went well with our salads. 

The food is fresh but light and I would almost use the word feminine, so if you are looking for a meat and wine kind of place, this might be a better spot to drink at with some appetizers and then you head somewhere else for your big sit down meal. Or it could be a lounging apres dinner kind of place. It has modern Ikea style chairs and tables with some couches but as I said, not so much of a restaurant feel with cushy chairs and carpets.

data.title: Great place for wine enthusiasts
data.text: I visited Vini Culture on a Saturday afternoon, and it wasn't very busy.  It is very cozy inside, with a few couches, and also some bistro tables.  The concept is so interesting!  You pay for a card ($20 minimum) and you're handed a glass and a wine menu.  I used the menu to decide which wines I wanted to taste.  Then you go to the machines, (sort of like a wine fountain), insert your card, and choose the wine you want.  You can choose from a taste, a small glass, and a large glass.  The wines I tried were all good, and I really enjoyed my visit.  They offer food and some tasty-looking desserts as well, but I didn't try any food, as I had just come from lunch.

data.title: Great Wine Bar
data.text: Vini Culture is a great place to relax and enjoy wine with friends, family and coworkers.  They have a great happy hour with some food options. Their enomatic wine dispensers are a great way to taste different wines.  The atmosphere here is fun and inviting. Cheers!

data.title: Neat place, surprisingly great taps and beer list
data.text: The pour yourself wine machines are pretty neat and the atmosphere is very chill. One can sit at the bar, outside, on a couch, at a table or stand and still be comfortable. The bar has a very good selection of beers, especially for a wine bar. Sometimes the beer is even more rare and hard to come by than larger places with more tap lines like Jojo's, The Blue Side and The Roast House. Go in to Vini Culture.

data.title: Donna rocks!
data.text: Donna, the owner, runs a moden 21st century tavern that perfectly fits into the Frederick downtown's spirit. Her wine-tasting machine and inventive salads are absolutely unforgettable. Donna supports other local businesses and the local artists. Do not miss your opportunity to get a membership card.

data.title: Still good and I still highly recommend!
data.text: I have reviewed Vini in the past and have given it a good review.  I haven't had the chance to visit in a while but I am delighted to say it is still a great place.  Service is good and the wines are great. Fun place to enjoy your friends or family's company. Many stay for long periods of time because there are so many great wines to taste and the accompanying food offerings are super. We just had the cheese board this time but it was really good. If they are offering the triple cream or drunken goat cheeses, definitely get it.  Those cheeses are sublime, especially the melt in your mouth triple cream.  It comes with a good portion of crostinis, a delicious chutney, dates, and a whole grain yummy mustard. A fantastic place for any occasion. Still highly recommend!

data.title: Just as Good as First Time
data.text: We stopped by Vini Culture Friday night.  It was our second time there.  The young man at the front, Dustin, was very nice and professional.  He was knowledgeable about the wines and very helpful.  We didn't have appetizers, but just enjoyed the wines and the atmosphere.  This is a very nice addition to downtown.  Keep up the great work and thank you Dustin!

data.title: Enjoyable First Experience
data.text: We met another couple here Friday night.  It was our first time here but not there's.  They really liked Vini Culture so we wanted to try it.  Our server Alex was very good.  She was very attentive and explained the concept with the wine card for their wine machines.  The wines were very good, and the appetizers were excellent.  Our friends got the 3 hummus with veggies and bread and we got the baked brie  Both were excellent.  Very fresh veggies and the baked brie had caramelized onions, nuts and berries.  I really think that this will become a regular stop for us.

data.title: Did their Wine Tasting - Njoyed it
data.text: This was a first Saturday event - did their wine tasting and was impressed with their server and vintner.  She explained the wines very well.  I was impressed with the menu for the cafe, although we did not eat anything.

data.title: Tasteful Delight
data.text: The atmosphere was a up beat live crowd, good for a date night with a loved one . It is a definite must try just for the experience alone. The dispensary system is something i have never seen before. My Fiance and i left with a new favorite wine.

data.title: Great Wine Bar and Eatery
data.text: If you are looking for a great wine tasting experience that offers great light fare, Vini Culture is the place. Staff are very attentive. Wine selections are great and easy to obtain from their dispensers.

data.title: Perfect place to end a night of Happy Hour and Dinner
data.text:
We visited Frederick for HH + Dinner... 
to finish our visit we went for our last drink to Vini Culture... Great place!!! Great service... we sat at the bar and had a long vivid conversation with the owner... who shared a lot of info about Frederick and kept us wishing to stay!!!  Another place we surely will visit during our 'once a month' visit to Frederick!!! We loved it!

data.title: Good for a group- tasty desserts
data.text: Nice place to meet people and have a few drinks. If you get a wine card, you can sample several different wines before you commit- gives you an opportunity to sample some wines you have not had before without much risk. The smallest pours were really small- not much more than a sip. The deserts were really good- recommend the tiramasou and the parfaits. The cheesecake was good, but dense and very rich. The set up is a bit confusing- you can get a card from the front, or from a waiter, but overall a fun time.

data.title: It Was OK for ME
data.text:
A group of six of us went before dinner and it was just OK for me.  I only drink white wine with food and prefer heavily oaked red wines.  I ended up not getting anything to drink.

The staff there can not answer basic questions about the wines  for example  approximately how long was the cab in oak? 

Pretty much all the wines were lower end wines with almost no higher end wines.  Just before we got ready to leave, I flipped through the menu and noticed a few higher end wines - I guess they keep behind the bar and pour by the glass.  Some of these looked good.  When I asked, I was told they just changed the menu and they no longer had any of these except one which was unopened and she didn't seem interested in opening it.    

Overall, they have a good lower end (not cheap - but like $10 - $20 per bottle) wine selection with several grape varieties most people probably have not tasted before.   This provides a nice opportunity to try different wines without purchasing the whole  bottle.  

Did not try the food as we had a reservation at the Tasting Room for a special occasion.  I would hire or train the staff there to answer questions about the wine and also be able to recommend wines based on the grape varieties customers know they already enjoy.  Overall - not my kind of place but I think many others would enjoy it.

data.title: Fantastic idea
data.text: Great idea to be able to try different wines without having to buy a bottle. Fun ambiance--bright and cheery!  Buy a "card" when you enter and try as many wines until the card is empty. Donna(the owner) is lovely and friendly--and promotes many fun activities--special events-all very reasonable. You can also join the wine club and get special prices on bottles. And the inventory is always changing. So if you like wine and really want to try something different stop there and also enjoy the rest of Old Town.

data.title: Nice Experience
data.text: We went for an early dinner/happy hour on a Friday, not too crowded and not loud, which you don't always find around there. The wines were good- we opted for the $5 happy hour wines vs. the tastings with the card, just because the ones they had were good. The food was small plates but we were glad, we were able to try a few and share- Caramelized Onion Flatbread, Olives, Brie, and the Roast Beef sandwich. Everything was good. Great attentive service without being in the way. Easy parking in several nearby garages. Not the place to go if you want a full sit down dinner (their menu is on their website) but if you want to talk and linger and eat it is perfect.
